elements.name: question1
rows: Marco is caught stealing from the store till.
The company's two apprentices, Laura and Fernando, have fallen in love and are in a relationship.
Danja falsifies receipts for an external training course paid for by her employer.
David learns that his employer is on the verge of bankruptcy and can therefore no longer pay his wages. He resigns without notice to take up a position with another company.
Michaela was out too late the night before, so she overslept and is late for work.
Pilot Eric is caught smoking a joint during a stopover at Amsterdam airport.
Ben has already repeatedly attracted negative attention because he has made lewd comments to female employees; now he has harassed a colleague in the elevator and grabbed her bottom.
Amir is late for work for the third time in a few weeks because his little daughter is ill, so he couldn't drop her off at nursery and had to organize a babysitting service at short notice.
Matteo and a colleague clash over a difference of opinion, whereupon Matteo punches his colleague in the face.
Selina is caught passing on secret business data to a rival company.
Dominik makes a private phone call to his girlfriend during working hours and is caught by his boss.
Construction worker Udo leaves the building site to do some quick shopping, even though he is expressly forbidden to leave the workplace.
During training, Luca tells a colleague that his boss is a jerk; he doesn't realize that his boss is sitting behind him and listening in on the conversation.
The boss learns that office worker Jessica took ecstasy during her vacation in Ibiza.
Philipp works as a temp in a movie theater and regularly lets colleagues into the theater for free. His employer finds out about it.
elements.title: Mark with a cross whether termination without notice is justified or not in the case studies in the following exercise.
